Story #8

  • April 21, 2021
  • Zizi

I landed in Moscow in the middle of March. It was cold and gray. I was very lucky to catch the last train to the city and my friend Denis met me with winter coat and shoes at his metro station. He gave me a warm bath and a sofa to sleep. I was glad to see him again and told him about my adventures. The next day I moved into the room with 3 more girls and a man. There were around 10 people in the flat, but luckily our schedules were so different that I was always on time with a free bathroom and kitchen. I jumped in the work right in. There were around 20 people in the team. During the work I found a case of corruption from 2 people. They were getting extra money from the companies, so we would sell their goods at the store. I found this out and fired those men. I was building a friendly atmosphere in the company, and this case was surprising and disappointing. I left the company after 6 months. The boss’s girlfriend started criticizing me, and they were always smoking weed on our meetings away from the office. I got tired of this treatment and decided to leave. The team said: “We will fight for you! We are the family! We want you to stay”. But no-one did anything. On the last day I came in Pikachu suit. You know that yellow creature from the anime. It was a great day. Only one girl also came in a suit. She was a Super girl with a small towel as a cape. We made lots of photos and had a nice lunch together.

After this job, something broke in me. No-one did anything to make me stay and “our family” did not really matter. I lived in a tiny studio and felt very lonely. Whole life I was giving, giving, giving. And then I was again at the age of my life alone. I got the same feeling that I do, care and give, and those people don’t care about me. I was consulting people on my weekends charging close to nothing, and they took it as it is. I felt deep disappointment and emptiness. I went through this day by day. After the shop I started again with the start-up we built in the previous year. I collected a good team of reliable people, taught them everything I knew about our deserts and cooking process. I was cooking lunch for the team. In September, I got a call from my ex-husband Alyosha. He invited me for coffee and wanted me back. I was glad to see him and I knew he did not understand why we divorced. We moved together with a Korean guy, his companion on selling sea creatures. We lived in someone’s one-room flat, then 3 rooms flat, then we were kicked out from it, because they did not pay the landlord. I paid my part and they did not. That flat was far away from my job, and I was again working like a devil. I realized this is enough. I took Alyosha, moved two of us in another flat, and explained that this way of earning money harmed the living beings and this is wrong. He went to visit his parents and think over what he wanted to do in life. He came back with his small dog, we lived before with and a friend who was broke. He was a man with the wife and 3 kids. He sent them to Thailand while he will figure out something. This guy Denis stayed with us till the new year. A couple of days before The New Year day I decided to get long colorful braids made with fake hair. I did not like the girl, who was making them, as well as her apartment and the whole atmosphere. The way home took me 2 hours on the metro. During those two hours I was feeling those braids. I did not like them at all. They were heavy, unpleasant and odd. Just like the master I got them from. I came home and Denis was there. I sat in front of a mirror and decided to shave. I took scissors and cut all the braids. Then I asked Denis to shave me, I could not do it on my own. It was a very intimate and trusting act. He felt so touched by my trust. And he was confused and shy with red chicks every time I looked at him. Denis was a tall strong man, but then he looked like a quite nice boy. We celebrated The New Year together with Alyosha, Denis, and one more man. We were in an LSD trip. Denis opened his heart with all the pain and told me his story. I felt him close and that I meet him rear in lives. He said he missed me so much.

That night my ex-husband told me that he understood why we divorced. The reason was that he was not ready for it, he is not ready for the responsibility. I agreed. He left me the next morning. They went to Crimea with Denis. He promised to come back for me and the dog, and help financially. He left on the first of January 2017. I stayed in a two-room flat, and I had no money to pay for it alone. He promised to give money, so I thought that’s fine, I just start looking for a neighbour. In the beginning of January I got an offer from my boss to create a professional video about raw deserts. She promised 30% plus 15000 rubbles for the 2 days of scooting and a contract. I needed money and I agreed. I also felt this need of sharing my 6 years of experience in this field. I had one week to write the video script and make the recipes. “Why such a short period of time?” you might ask. Well, because my boss did not bother to inform me earlier. I did what was needed and earned money for the shooting. It was my first time of making professional video, with the makeup and on professional fancy kitchen. I was shaking, but I did everything pretty well, because I knew my business. I had lots of work to do on the main job and I had to do more stuff for those 30% from the video course. The company did nothing and got 70%. In a while of running and been tired I asked for 40% and rise in the salary on the production because the boss hired the girl who knew nothing of raw production or desserts for a higher salary. I did not hire the girl, because the team did not like it. So I asked the boss to do the job of a chef and top manager. In the weekends I was giving psychological consultations and trying to build my own project with production with 2 girls from the previous job. So I was extremely busy. Plus I had to look after Alyosha’s dog. At the end of the month I could not find a renter, so I called Alyosha asking if he was going to send any money as he promised and what he is going to do with his dog. He said: “Well, I have no money. So I won’t send you anything. I’ll come soon with my dad on a car to grab my dog and stuff”. And that was it. Thank was a big luck with the video course because I had just enough money to pay for the apartment and food for the next month.

I was working for the production, for the backing school, supporting my video course and gave psychological consultations. It was an intense time. In March my buddy Myron called. We worked together in the café and I rented a room from him once. He said that his friend is in the city and I invited them for tea. I was glad to see Myron and his friend Ramon. I saw Ramon in 2015 right after my divorce, and I liked him, but I was not ready for any relationships. I rented out the room to a nice girl and Ramon was looking for a room. I felt I want to be near this man. We agreed that he will rent a room in my apartment and I have to tell this to the girl. We went for some dates with Ramon and moved in my room. The apartment was quite far from the metro and Ramon wanted to find another one near his job. We found a small apartment and Ramon wanted to move there at once. I called the landlord asking if we can move out earlier than a month and can I get the deposit money back. She agreed to everything. She lived in another city, and I was going to find new people and show the apartment. During the time I lived in it, I changed the floor in the apartment, put wallpaper in the kitchen, corridor and toilet. So the flat was improved by me a lot. One evening I could not show the flat to new people and the landlord asked if I can give the keys to her friends. I agreed. How silly I was. There was some of my stuff in the flat still. I did not hear anything from the landlord for two days after that, so I called her. She said that people moved in the flat already. I asked about my stuff and the money. She said the contract says I had to warn her one-month prior, and our phone talk proves nothing. The contract was left in the flat. Then I asked about the keys, she did not realize that I had the second pair of keys. She tried to make me come to the metro and give her keys, promising that she will send me some money later. I did not give her the keys. I just cried sitting in the washroom. 35 thousand were gone. It was half of my salary doing 2 jobs. The landlord was crying too, saying: “my parents are ill, so I need money”. I did not go the flat to grab the contract, although I had the right to stay in the flat for a month at list. I did want to go along the road of doing harm to anyone. I stayed at home and cried. It felt so unfair. And I had only one question in my head, which was: “why?why this happening to me”. This is a pretty existential thing. Why do bad things happen to us? Is this a payment for something we have done before? Who decides why, when, and who we will pay this debt? And when did we create this debt? The word Karma is pretty popular now. Everything bad can be explained by it. If something bad happens to you this means you did something wrong. So you kind of deserve to get this bad anything. It is very hard to admit such a thing. Especially when you don’t know anything. It is hard to agree to bad things. I thought: “I don’t deserve this. I deserve good things”. At the same time it is not clear if we’ve done something bad to the person who harms us, or it is random.

Ramon never paid attention to my feelings. We did not really talk. We were living like comfortable neighbours sharing our meals, a flat and a bad. From the very beginning he kept saying: “You should not attach to me, this can happen any second”. I was asking myself why is he with me, why do we live together, what does he feel. He never answered. He never helped around the house and may be cooked once or twice in a year when I was ill. During the year living together I pushed myself deep inside. I stopped asking questions, stopped trying to talk with him and stopped sharing my thoughts, because he always made fun of them with his friends. I stopped listening to people and started to meditate a lot, because any problem or conflict was arising we never talked we meditated and that was the end of it. Autumn came and I decided to leave my jobs. Ramon earned enough for both of us. He never said that I should leave my jobs. I was doing everything around the house, cooking and working on 2 jobs. That was too much for me. Ramon pushed an idea to become a programmer in me, saying how great this is. He said this can provide me money and I can travel and work online. I wanted to travel, wanted to leave Moscow, wanted to earn money without working like a horse.

When I left the job, the company took my video course project. Remember my naive nature. I never got the contract, so when I left the production, they took the video course. I shared my password with a girl in the production. I taught her everything, and she agreed to look after the video course, so she’ll get my percentage. After leaving, I also learned that my team was talking bad behind my back.

I tried to study programming when I had my jobs, but I was exhausted most time, so I left the jobs to study more. Ramon was supporting me financially but never helped with the studying even though he was working as a programmer.

Winter passed and spring came again. I found the company who was ready to take me without much knowledge. And it should be a one-year contract. I was excited. But Ramon decided to go on travelling. He decided to go to Crimea for the summer and in October go to India. He said I can choose what I want. And it was clear he will not wait for me or stay one more year for me to get the job. I decided to go with him.

Crimea was very nice. We met some people, lived by the sea in the tent, moved a lot. We came back to Moscow for a month to get the visas done, and I spent that month in Vipassana meditation centre serving. I served a lot at the centre, when I left my jobs. In October everything was ready for our trip. I felt I’m leaving Moscow for 3 years. I felt like I met everyone whom I was supposed to meet, consult and help, and this is the end of Moscow. Everything was done and I was ready to leave. I met all my close friends, huge them, said goodbye, knowing that I will not see them for a long time.
